alert.note: Alert for Madison (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 23 at 3:15AM CDT until March 24 at 3:40PM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Alabama... Flint River at Brownsboro affecting Madison County. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Flint River at Brownsboro. * WHEN...Until tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, Water begins to flood yards on the downstream side of the Brownsboro Road bridge. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:30 AM CDT Wednesday the stage was 16.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early this morning to a crest of 18.8 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 18.8 feet on 11/24/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
